segment.source: Use cross-slide to support selection with the swipe gesture and drag (move) interactions with the slide gesture.
segment.target: Use cross-slide to support selection with the swipe gesture and drag (move) interactions with the slide gesture.

segment.target: Guidelines for cross-slide

segment.target: Guidelines for cross-slide

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: CrossSliding
segment.target: CrossSliding

segment.source: CrossSlideThresholds
segment.target: CrossSlideThresholds

segment.source: Windows.UI.Input
segment.target: Windows.UI.Input

segment.source: Use cross-slide to support selection with the swipe gesture and drag (move) interactions with the slide gesture.
segment.target: Use cross-slide to support selection with the swipe gesture and drag (move) interactions with the slide gesture.

segment.source: Dos and don'ts
segment.target: Dos and don'ts

segment.source: Use cross-slide for lists or collections that scroll in a single direction.
segment.target: Use cross-slide for lists or collections that scroll in a single direction.

segment.source: Use cross-slide for item selection when the tap interaction is used for another purpose.
segment.target: Use cross-slide for item selection when the tap interaction is used for another purpose.

segment.source: Don't use cross-slide for adding items to a queue.
segment.target: Don't use cross-slide for adding items to a queue.

segment.source: Additional usage guidance
segment.target: Additional usage guidance

segment.source: Selection and drag are possible only within a content area that is pannable in one direction (vertical or horizontal).
segment.target: Selection and drag are possible only within a content area that is pannable in one direction (vertical or horizontal).

segment.source: For either interaction to work, one panning direction must be locked and the gesture must be performed in the direction perpendicular to the panning direction.
segment.target: For either interaction to work, one panning direction must be locked and the gesture must be performed in the direction perpendicular to the panning direction.

segment.source: Here we demonstrate selecting and dragging an object using a cross-slide.
segment.target: Here we demonstrate selecting and dragging an object using a cross-slide.

segment.source: The image on the left shows how an item is selected if a swipe gesture doesn't cross a distance threshold before the contact is lifted and the object released.
segment.target: The image on the left shows how an item is selected if a swipe gesture doesn't cross a distance threshold before the contact is lifted and the object released.

segment.source: The image on the right shows a sliding gesture that crosses a distance threshold and results in the object being dragged.
segment.target: The image on the right shows a sliding gesture that crosses a distance threshold and results in the object being dragged.

segment.source: diagram showing the select and drag and drop processes.
segment.target: diagram showing the select and drag and drop processes.

segment.source: The threshold distances used by the cross-slide interaction are shown in the following diagram.
segment.target: The threshold distances used by the cross-slide interaction are shown in the following diagram.

segment.source: screen shot showing the select and drag and drop processes.
segment.target: screen shot showing the select and drag and drop processes.

segment.source: To preserve panning functionality, a small threshold of 2.7mm (approximately 10 pixels at target resolution) must be crossed before either a select or drag interaction is activated.
segment.target: To preserve panning functionality, a small threshold of 2.7mm (approximately 10 pixels at target resolution) must be crossed before either a select or drag interaction is activated.

segment.source: This small threshold helps the system to differentiate cross-sliding from panning, and also helps ensure that a tap gesture is distinguished from both cross-sliding and panning.
segment.target: This small threshold helps the system to differentiate cross-sliding from panning, and also helps ensure that a tap gesture is distinguished from both cross-sliding and panning.

segment.source: This image shows how a user touches an element in the UI, but moves their finger down slightly at contact.
segment.target: This image shows how a user touches an element in the UI, but moves their finger down slightly at contact.

segment.source: With no threshold, the interaction would be interpreted as a cross-slide because of the initial vertical movement.
segment.target: With no threshold, the interaction would be interpreted as a cross-slide because of the initial vertical movement.

segment.source: With the threshold, the movement is interpreted correctly as horizontal panning.
segment.target: With the threshold, the movement is interpreted correctly as horizontal panning.

segment.source: screen shot showing the select or drag and drop disambiguation threshold.
segment.target: screen shot showing the select or drag and drop disambiguation threshold.

segment.source: Here are some guidelines to consider when including cross-slide functionality in your app.
segment.target: Here are some guidelines to consider when including cross-slide functionality in your app.

segment.source: Use cross-slide for lists or collections that scroll in a single direction.
segment.target: Use cross-slide for lists or collections that scroll in a single direction.

segment.source: For more information, see Adding ListView controls.
segment.target: For more information, see Adding ListView controls.

segment.source: Note In cases where the content area can be panned in two directions, such as web browsers or e-readers, the press-and-hold timed interaction should be used to invoke the context menu for objects such as images and hyperlinks.
segment.target: Note In cases where the content area can be panned in two directions, such as web browsers or e-readers, the press-and-hold timed interaction should be used to invoke the context menu for objects such as images and hyperlinks.

segment.source: horizontal-panning, two-dimensional list
segment.target: horizontal-panning, two-dimensional list

segment.source: vertical-panning, one-dimensional list
segment.target: vertical-panning, one-dimensional list

segment.source: A horizontally panning two-dimensional list.
segment.target: A horizontally panning two-dimensional list.

segment.source: Drag vertically to select or move an item.
segment.target: Drag vertically to select or move an item.

segment.source: A vertically panning one-dimensional list.
segment.target: A vertically panning one-dimensional list.

segment.source: Drag horizontally to select or move an item.
segment.target: Drag horizontally to select or move an item.

segment.source: Selecting
segment.target: Selecting

segment.source: Selection is the marking, without launching or activating, of one or more objects.
segment.target: Selection is the marking, without launching or activating, of one or more objects.

segment.source: This action is analogous to a single mouse click, or Shift key and mouse click, on one or more objects.
segment.target: This action is analogous to a single mouse click, or Shift key and mouse click, on one or more objects.

segment.source: Cross-slide selection is achieved by touching an element and releasing it after a short dragging interaction.
segment.target: Cross-slide selection is achieved by touching an element and releasing it after a short dragging interaction.

segment.source: This method of selection dispenses with both the dedicated selection mode and the press-and-hold timed interaction required by other touch interfaces and does not conflict with the tap interaction for activation.
segment.target: This method of selection dispenses with both the dedicated selection mode and the press-and-hold timed interaction required by other touch interfaces and does not conflict with the tap interaction for activation.

segment.source: In addition to the distance threshold, cross-slide selection is constrained to a 90° threshold area, as shown in the following diagram.
segment.target: In addition to the distance threshold, cross-slide selection is constrained to a 90° threshold area, as shown in the following diagram.

segment.source: If the object is dragged outside of this area, it is not selected.
segment.target: If the object is dragged outside of this area, it is not selected.

segment.source: diagram showing the selection threshold area.
segment.target: diagram showing the selection threshold area.

segment.source: The cross-slide interaction is supplemented by a press-and-hold timed interaction, also referred to as a "self-revealing" interaction.
segment.target: The cross-slide interaction is supplemented by a press-and-hold timed interaction, also referred to as a "self-revealing" interaction.

segment.source: This supplemental interaction activates an animation that indicates what action can be performed on the object.
segment.target: This supplemental interaction activates an animation that indicates what action can be performed on the object.

segment.source: For more information on disambiguation UI, see Guidelines for visual feedback.
segment.target: For more information on disambiguation UI, see Guidelines for visual feedback.

segment.source: The following screen shots demonstrate how the self-revealing animation works.
segment.target: The following screen shots demonstrate how the self-revealing animation works.

segment.source: Press and hold to initiate the animation for the self-revealing interaction.
segment.target: Press and hold to initiate the animation for the self-revealing interaction.

segment.source: The selected state of the item affects what is revealed by the animation: a check mark if unselected and no check mark if selected.
segment.target: The selected state of the item affects what is revealed by the animation: a check mark if unselected and no check mark if selected.

segment.source: screen shot showing an unselected state.
segment.target: screen shot showing an unselected state.

segment.source: Select the item using the swipe gesture (up or down).
segment.target: Select the item using the swipe gesture (up or down).

segment.source: screen shot showing the animation for selection.
segment.target: screen shot showing the animation for selection.

segment.source: The item is now selected.
segment.target: The item is now selected.

segment.source: Override the selection behavior using the slide gesture to move the item.
segment.target: Override the selection behavior using the slide gesture to move the item.

segment.source: screen shot showing the animation for drag and drop.
segment.target: screen shot showing the animation for drag and drop.

segment.source: Use a single tap for selection in applications where it is the only primary action.
segment.target: Use a single tap for selection in applications where it is the only primary action.

segment.source: The cross-slide self-revealing animation is displayed to disambiguate this functionality from the standard tap interaction for activation and navigation.
segment.target: The cross-slide self-revealing animation is displayed to disambiguate this functionality from the standard tap interaction for activation and navigation.

segment.source: Selection basket
segment.target: Selection basket

segment.source: The selection basket is a visually distinct and dynamic representation of items that have been selected from the primary list or collection in the application.
segment.target: The selection basket is a visually distinct and dynamic representation of items that have been selected from the primary list or collection in the application.

segment.source: This feature is useful for tracking selected items and should be used by applications where:
segment.target: This feature is useful for tracking selected items and should be used by applications where:

segment.source: Items can be selected from multiple locations.
segment.target: Items can be selected from multiple locations.

segment.source: Many items can be selected.
segment.target: Many items can be selected.

segment.source: An action or command relies upon the selection list.
segment.target: An action or command relies upon the selection list.

segment.source: The content of the selection basket persists across actions and commands.
segment.target: The content of the selection basket persists across actions and commands.

segment.source: For example, if you select a series of photographs from a gallery, apply a color correction to each photograph, and share the photographs in some fashion, the items remain selected.
segment.target: For example, if you select a series of photographs from a gallery, apply a color correction to each photograph, and share the photographs in some fashion, the items remain selected.

segment.source: If no selection basket is used in an application, the current selection should be cleared after an action or command.
segment.target: If no selection basket is used in an application, the current selection should be cleared after an action or command.

segment.source: For example, if you select a song from a play list and rate it, the selection should be cleared.
segment.target: For example, if you select a song from a play list and rate it, the selection should be cleared.

segment.source: The current selection should also be cleared when no selection basket is used and another item in the list or collection is activated.
segment.target: The current selection should also be cleared when no selection basket is used and another item in the list or collection is activated.

segment.source: For example, if you select an inbox message, the preview pane is updated.
segment.target: For example, if you select an inbox message, the preview pane is updated.

segment.source: Then, if you select a second inbox message, the selection of the previous message is canceled and the preview pane is updated.
segment.target: Then, if you select a second inbox message, the selection of the previous message is canceled and the preview pane is updated.

segment.source: Queues
segment.target: Queues

segment.source: A queue is not equivalent to the selection basket list and should not be treated as such.
segment.target: A queue is not equivalent to the selection basket list and should not be treated as such.

segment.source: The primary distinctions include:
segment.target: The primary distinctions include:

segment.source: The list of items in the selection basket is only a visual representation; the items in a queue are assembled with a specific action in mind.
segment.target: The list of items in the selection basket is only a visual representation; the items in a queue are assembled with a specific action in mind.

segment.source: Items can be represented only once in the selection basket but multiple times in a queue.
segment.target: Items can be represented only once in the selection basket but multiple times in a queue.

segment.source: The order of items in the selection basket represents the order of selection.
segment.target: The order of items in the selection basket represents the order of selection.

segment.source: The order of items in a queue is directly related to functionality.
segment.target: The order of items in a queue is directly related to functionality.

segment.source: For these reasons, the cross-slide selection interaction should not be used to add items to a queue.
segment.target: For these reasons, the cross-slide selection interaction should not be used to add items to a queue.

segment.source: Instead, items should be added to a queue through a drag action.
segment.target: Instead, items should be added to a queue through a drag action.

segment.source: Drag
segment.target: Drag

segment.source: Use drag to move one or more objects from one location to another.
segment.target: Use drag to move one or more objects from one location to another.

segment.source: If more than one object needs to be moved, let users select multiple items and then drag all at one time.
segment.target: If more than one object needs to be moved, let users select multiple items and then drag all at one time.
